8783d8f6-a4a4-455c-bb37-06b329bfd8f6.description: The earner of this badge completed one Network Management Associate course and attained the knowledge and ability to perform duties of an Infrastructure Technician, with the basic knowledge of the Layer Two/Three of the Open Systems Interconnection (OSI) Model, network switching/routing configurations, TCP/IP, VoIP, and Network Security.
8783d8f6-a4a4-455c-bb37-06b329bfd8f6.name: Network Management Infrastructure Associate

alignments.name: Network Management Infrastructure-Associate (NMIA)
alignments.description: Graduates of the NMIA course will demonstrate competency in basic instructions, procedures, and implementation of multi-layer switched networks along with an introduction to wireless networking concepts and terminology, and performance-based skills.

alignments.name: Cisco Certified Network Associate (CCNA)
alignments.description: Earners of the CCNA certification will demonstrate competency in knowledge and skills related to network fundamentals, network access, IP connectivity, IP services, security fundamentals, and automation and programmability.

alignments.name: Juniper Enterprise Routing and Switching Certification (JNCIA-Junos)
alignments.description: Earners of the JNCIA certification will demonstrate competency in JUNOS OS fundamentals, user interfaces, configuration basics, operational monitoring and maintenance, routing fundamentals, routing policy, and firewall filters.

badge_template_activities.title: Complete one Network Management Associate course (NMIA,  CCNA, JNCIA-Junos, or equivalency).
Complete the NMI checklist.
The checklist was reviewed by the Earner's supervisor and recommended for the award of the NMI Associate badge.
For additional information on the Cyberspace Support digital badge initiative and the earning process, please see the linked information sheet.

6299763d-4594-42af-af39-137f7945a09b.description: The earner of this badge has foundational knowledge of Cyberspace Project Management responsibilities and procedures with an understanding of: communications and information systems planning, plans planning, agreements, maintaining cyber & transport records.
6299763d-4594-42af-af39-137f7945a09b.name: Cyberspace Project Management - Bronze

alignments.name: CompTIA Project+
alignments.description: CompTIA Project+ gives business professionals – inside and outside of IT – the basic concepts to successfully manage small- to medium-sized projects.

alignments.name: Air Force Cyberspace Project Management course
alignments.description: Air Force Cyberspace Project management course will demonstrate competency in: Project Requirements, Meetings, Site Surveys, Project Support Agreements (PSA), Project Binders, Work Requests, Project Acceptance, and Documentation.

badge_template_activities.title: Complete Air Force Cyberspace Project Management course (or equivalent) that includes an understanding of: communications and information systems planning, plans planning, agreements, maintaining cyber & transport records. Please see the suggested courses in the standards area below.

Complete the following six SkillPort courses: (1) Project Management Introduction (apj_28_a01_bs_enus); (2) Project Management Process Groups (apj_28_a03_bs_enus); (3) Project Initiation (apj_17_a01_bs_enus); (4) Managing Project Work (apj_17_a02_bs_enus); (5) Project Changes and Closing (apj_17_a03_bs_enus); (6) Planning Risk Management (apj_24_a01_bs_enus) (NOTE: Skillport is CAC enabled).
Complete the Cyberspace Project Management bronze checklist.
The checklist was reviewed by the Earner's supervisor and recommended for the award of the Cyberspace Project Management - Bronze badge.
For additional information on the Cyberspace Support digital badge initiative and the earning process, please see the link information sheet.

8f4bb982-8089-432d-b958-00098ee134a6.description: The earner of this badge has at least 6 months' experience managing medium-scale Cyberspace projects by performing communications and information systems planning, plans planning, agreements, military construction (MILCON) program, and managing cyber records.
8f4bb982-8089-432d-b958-00098ee134a6.name: Cyberspace Project Management - Silver

alignments.name: Certified Associate in Project Management (CAPM)®
alignments.description: Mid-level industry certification completion reflects earner is credited on how to initiate, monitor, execute, control, and complete a project.

badge_template_activities.title: Cyberspace Project Management - Bronze

Complete at least 6 months in a Cyberspace Project Management position that requires executing communications and information systems planning, plans planning, agreements, military construction (MILCON) program, and managing cyber records.
Manage at least 5 medium-scaled Cyberspace projects valued between $40K and $250K.

Compile a Cyberspace portfolio, or documented resume equivalent, which outlines a detailed description and scope of each project and the organizations it supported, hours dedicated and coordinated with planning, plans planning, acquisitions, and lessons learned. (reference checklist for accuracy)
Complete the Cyberspace Project Management-Silver checklist.
The checklist was reviewed by the Earner's supervisor and recommended for the award of the Cyberspace Project Management-Silver badge.
For additional information on the Cyberspace Support digital badge initiative and the earning process, please see the linked information sheet.

ea36d8c7-2c1b-491c-bf30-c3c6bb0292c0.description: The earner of this badge demonstrated foundational knowledge of Cyberspace Quality Assurance through an understanding of management directives, self-evaluation and assessment reviews, government requirements, equipment evaluation, and trend analysis summary.
ea36d8c7-2c1b-491c-bf30-c3c6bb0292c0.name: Cyberspace Quality Assurance - Bronze

badge_template_activities.title: Complete Air Force Cyberspace Quality Assurance Course, which provides foundational knowledge for management directives, self-evaluation and assessment reviews, government requirements, equipment evaluation, and trend analysis summary.
Complete the Cyberspace Quality Assurance - Bronze checklist.
The checklist was reviewed by the Earner's supervisor and recommended for the award of the Cyberspace Quality Assurance - Bronze badge.
For additional information on the Cyberspace Support digital badge initiative and the earning process, please see the linked information sheet.

8287120e-18f8-46d7-9c9e-32dfd4ef9ca2.description: The earner of this badge has fulfilled at least 24 months in a Cyberspace Quality Assurance position and implemented management directives and performed self-evaluation and assessment reviews, government requirements, equipment evaluation, and trend analysis summary.
8287120e-18f8-46d7-9c9e-32dfd4ef9ca2.name: Cyberspace Quality Assurance - Gold

badge_template_activities.title: Cyberspace Quality Assurance - Silver
Complete at least 24 months in a Cyberspace Quality Assurance position.
Implement management directives and perform self-evaluation and assessment reviews, government requirements, equipment evaluation, and trend analysis summary.
Complete the Cyberspace Quality Assurance - Gold checklist.
The checklist was reviewed by the Earner's supervisor and recommended for the award of the Cyberspace Quality Assurance - Gold badge.
For additional information on the Cyberspace Support digital badge initiative and the earning process, please see the linked information sheet.

79f41d02-0079-4165-a211-042e68dea31b.description: The earner of this badge has fulfilled at least 12 months in a Cyberspace Quality Assurance position and implemented management directives and performed self-evaluation and assessment reviews, government requirements, equipment evaluation, and trend analysis summary.
79f41d02-0079-4165-a211-042e68dea31b.name: Cyberspace Quality Assurance - Silver

badge_template_activities.title: Cyberspace Quality Assurance - Bronze
Complete at least 6-months in a Cyberspace Quality Assurance position.

Performs evaluations in support of the Organization's personnel, equipment, standard publications, and technical order systems, change management, deficiency reporting, and analytical and investigative procedures and programs.
Complete Cyberspace Quality Assurance - Silver checklist.
The checklist was reviewed by the Earner's supervisor and recommended for the award of the Cyberspace Quality Assurance - Silver badge.
For additional information on the Cyberspace Support digital badge initiative and the earning process, please see the linked information sheet.

4b2b0eb8-f603-464b-8184-e8533aeb0318.description: The earner of this badge completed one Network Management Professional course, attained the knowledge and ability to perform duties as a Network Engineer, passed the third party evaluation, and has advanced troubleshooting knowledge for configuration changes to the Layer Two/Three of the Open Systems Interconnection (OSI) Model, network switching/routing configurations, TCP/IP, VoIP, and Network Security.
4b2b0eb8-f603-464b-8184-e8533aeb0318.name: Network Management Infrastructure Professional

alignments.name: Network Management Infrastructure Professional (NMIP)
alignments.description: Graduates of the NMI-P course will demonstrate competency in Advanced Layer 2 (e.g., spanning-trees, link aggregation, first-hop redundancy, private VLANs, and network monitoring) and Advanced Layer 3 (e.g., routing fundamentals, EIGRP, OSPF, BGP, redistribution and filtering, GRE & recursive routing, IPSec, VRF-Lite, and IPv6).

alignments.name: Cisco Certified Network Professional (CCNP)
alignments.description: Cisco Certified Network Professional (CCNP) Routing and Switching certification validates the ability to plan, implement, verify and troubleshoot local and wide-area enterprise networks and work collaboratively with specialists on advanced security, voice, wireless and video solutions.

alignments.name: Juniper Enterprise Routing and Switching Specialist (JNCIS-ENT)
alignments.description: Earners of the JNCIS-ENT certification will demonstrate competency in JUNOS OS fundamentals, layer 2 switching or VLANs, spanning tree, layer 2 security, protocol independent routing (OSPF, IS-IS, BGP), tunnels, and high availability.

badge_template_activities.title: Complete one Network Management Professional course (NMIP, CCNP, JNCIS-ENT, or equivalency).

The Earner will provide evidence of completing all Network Configuration Computer Based Training (CBT) for Cisco Certified Entry Networking Technician (CCENT) listed in Air Force Job Qualification Standard (JQS) 3DXXX-200CH, covering Layer Two/Three of the Open Systems Interconnection Model, network switching/routing configurations, TCP/IP, VoIP, and Network Security (NOTE: Skillport is CAC enabled).

Perform the duties of an Infrastructure Technician for a minimum of 3 years (e.g., Air Force Network Operations Security Center/Network Control Center (NOSC/NCC), Base Communications Support, and Air Communications Squadrons).
Pass a third party evaluation assessing the individual's knowledge, competency, technical proficiency, and qualifications to perform the job of a Network Infrastructure Technician.
Complete the NMI checklist.
The checklist was reviewed by the Earner's supervisor and recommended for the award of the NMI Professional badge.
For additional information on the Cyberspace Support digital badge initiative and the earning process, please see the linked information sheet.

aece9a8a-a27f-43af-b1c2-e99d9bfe4e0b.description: The earner of this badge demonstrated an understanding of the Agile Manifesto (4 values and 12 principles for software development), terminology, philosophy, and methodologies by applying the concepts to develop a software solution with consideration of the advantages and disadvantages of the Agile processes.
aece9a8a-a27f-43af-b1c2-e99d9bfe4e0b.name: Agile Software Development Fundamentals

issuer.summary: issued by Cyberspace Support (AFSC 3DXXX) and authorized by United States Air Force

alignments.name: Agile Principles and Methodologies
alignments.description: e-Learning course that covers the fundamental Agile concepts (8 Agile values and 12 Agile principles), the 5 phases of the Agile project management model, the most common Agile methodologies and frameworks, and the key activities for managing an Agile project. (NOTE: SkillPort is CAC enabled)

alignments.name: Introduction to Agile Software Development
alignments.description: e-Learning course that covers agile software development as well as the principles and values behind the agile manifesto. (NOTE: SkillPort is CAC enabled)

alignments.name: Introduction to Agile & Scrum
alignments.description: A Udemy course that covers the Agile Manifesto, common roles associated with Agile methods and Scrum. (NOTE: Udemy requires an account, which can be signed up for through the Airmen Coders initiative, www.airmencoders.us)

alignments.name: SENG 593 Agile Software Systems
alignments.description: A 10-week graduate-level distance learning course hosted by the Air Force Institute of Technology (AFIT).

badge_template_activities.title: Complete a training course that covers Agile concepts, terminology, philosophy, and methodologies. At a minimum, it must cover the Agile Manifesto, common roles associated with Agile methods, and 12 Agile principles and values for software development.
Write a personal reflection describing the application of Agile concepts to a non-Agile development process either from personal experience or a hypothetical application to an existing process.
Complete the Agile Software Development Fundamentals rubric.
The rubric was reviewed by Earner's supervisor and recommended for the award of the Agile Software Development Fundamentals badge.
For additional information on the Cyberspace Support digital badge initiative and the earning process, please see the linked information sheet.

cce550b6-8b5b-419b-b076-7d49bf0fcd8e.description: The earner of this badge demonstrated an understanding of C-language concepts including conditional and iterative program control flow, memory allocation and management, string manipulation, data types, basic usage of assemblers and compilers, function calls, pointers, data structures, and algorithms. The earner identified problems with the provided example code and corrected them.
cce550b6-8b5b-419b-b076-7d49bf0fcd8e.name: C-Language Developer - Basic

alignments.name: National Institute for Standards and Technology
alignments.description: NIST standard SP-DEV-001: Develops and writes/codes new (or modifies existing) computer applications, software, or specialized utility programs following software assurance best practices.

badge_template_activities.title: Submit a sample of working, compilable stand-alone code. Code must demonstrate C basics, pointer usage, memory management, arrays, bit-wise and logical operators, looping, input handling, string manipulation, and algorithms.
Perform corrective maintenance on a selection of code and ensure proper use of variable scope, memory management, and safe functions.
Complete the C Language Developer - Basic checklist.
The checklist was reviewed by the Earner's supervisor and recommended for the award of the C-Language Developer badge.
For additional information on the Cyberspace Support digital badge initiative and the earning process, please see the linked information sheet.

7133a5df-f96c-4218-8518-51148aec34bf.description: The earner of this badge completed two Network Management Associate courses and performed duties of an Infrastructure Technician, passed the third party evaluation, and displayed competency in Layer Two/Three of the Open Systems Interconnection (OSI) Model, network switching/routing configurations, TCP/IP, VoIP, and Network Security.
7133a5df-f96c-4218-8518-51148aec34bf.name: Network Management Infrastructure Technician

alignments.name: Network Management Infrastructure Associate (NMIA)
alignments.description: Graduates of the NMIA course will demonstrate competency in basic instructions, procedures, and implementation of multi-layer switched networks along with introduction to wireless networking concepts and terminology, and performance-based skills.

alignments.name: Cisco Certified Network Associate (CCNA)
alignments.description: Earners of the CCNA certification will demonstrate competency in knowledge and skills related to network fundamentals, network access, IP connectivity, IP services, security fundamentals, and automation and programability.

alignments.name: Juniper Enterprise Routing and Switching Certification (JNCIA-Junos)
alignments.description: Earners of the JNCIA-Junos certification will demonstrate competency in JUNOS OS fundamentals, user interfaces, configuration basics, operational monitoring and maintenance, routing fundamentals, routing policy, and firewall filters.

badge_template_activities.title: Complete two Network Management courses (NMIA, CCNA, JNCIA-Junos, or equivalency).

The Earner will provide evidence of completing all Network Configuration Computer Based Training (CBT) for Cisco Certified Entry Networking Technician (CCENT) listed in Air Force Job Qualification Standard (JQS) 3DXXX-200CH, covering Layer Two/Three of the Open Systems Interconnection Model, network switching/routing configurations, TCP/IP, VoIP, and Network Security (NOTE: Skillport is CAC enabled).

Perform the duties of an Infrastructure Technician for a minimum of 1 year (e.g., Air Force Network Operations Security Center/Network Control Center (NOSC/NCC), Base Communications Support, and Air Communications Squadrons).
Pass a third party evaluation assessing the individual's knowledge, competency, technical proficiency, and qualifications to perform the job of a Network Infrastructure Technician.
Complete the NMI Checklist.
The checklist was reviewed by the Earner's supervisor and recommended for the award of the NMI Technician badge.
For additional information on the Cyberspace Support digital badge initiative and the earning process, please see the linked information sheet.

8974ff8a-f544-4d66-a7a6-ed57d92d2369.description: The earner of this badge executed Cyberspace Project Management through at least 3 years that include communications and information systems planning, plans planning, agreements, Military Construction (MILCON) program, and validating cyber & transport records. The earner developed training plans and while leading Cyberspace Project Managers, in support of the Organization.
8974ff8a-f544-4d66-a7a6-ed57d92d2369.name: Cyberspace Project Management - Gold

alignments.name: Project Management Professional (PMP)®
alignments.description: PMP is an industry-recognized gold standard credential that validates an earner's competence to perform in the role of a project manager, leading and directing projects and teams.

badge_template_activities.title: Cyberspace Project Management - Silver

Complete at least (3 years) of cumulative time in a Cyberspace Project Manager position that executed advanced management knowledge of communications and information systems planning, plans planning, agreements, validates cyber & transport records.
Develop a work center training plan and continuously lead the Cyberspace Project Management team.

Compile a portfolio that includes several projects detailing out a description and scope of each project, the organizations it supported along with size, cost, complexity, lessons learned, and time allocated towards managing each project. The portfolio must reflect the earner has dedicated 3 years towards or completed 15 or more Cyberspace projects.
Complete Cyberspace Project Management - Gold Checklist
The checklist was reviewed by the Earner's supervisor and recommended for the award of the Cyberspace Project Management - Gold badge.
For additional information on the Cyberspace Support digital badge initiative and the earning process, please see the linked information sheet.

2381ab56-fcc2-40d1-8aad-b320530ded4d.description: The earner of this badge completed two Network Management Professional courses, performed duties as a Network Engineer, passed the third party evaluation, and displayed advanced troubleshooting competency by improving network efficiency and/or design by making configuration changes to the Layer Two/Three of the Open Systems Interconnection (OSI) Model, network switching/routing configurations, TCP/IP, VoIP, and Network Security.
2381ab56-fcc2-40d1-8aad-b320530ded4d.name: Network Management Infrastructure Engineer

alignments.name: Network Management Infrastructure Professional (NMIP)
alignments.description: Graduates of the NMI-P course will demonstrate competency in Advanced Layer 2 (e.g., spanning-trees, link aggregation, first-hop redundancy, private VLANs, and network monitoring) and Advanced Layer 3 (e.g., routing fundamentals, EIGRP, OSPF, BGP, redistribution and filtering, GRE & recursive routing, IPSec, VRF-Lite, and IPv6).

alignments.name: Cisco Certified Network Professional (CCNP)
alignments.description: Cisco Certified Network Professional (CCNP) Routing and Switching certification validates the ability to plan, implement, verify and troubleshoot local and wide-area enterprise networks and work collaboratively with specialists on advanced security, voice, wireless and video solutions.

alignments.name: Juniper Enterprise Routing and Switching Specialist (JNCIS-ENT)
alignments.description: Earners of the JNCIS-ENT certification will demonstrate competency in JUNOS OS fundamentals, layer 2 switching or VLANs, spanning tree, layer 2 security, protocol independent routing (OSPF, IS-IS, BGP), tunnels, and high availability.

badge_template_activities.title: Cyberspace Project Management - Silver
Complete two Network Management Professional courses (NMIP, CCNP, JNCIS-ENT, or equivalency).

The Earner will provide evidence of completing all Network Configuration Computer Based Training (CBT) for Cisco Certified Entry Networking Technician (CCENT) listed in Air Force Job Qualification Standard (JQS) 3DXXX-200CH, covering Layer Two/Three of the Open Systems Interconnection Model, network switching/routing configurations, TCP/IP, VoIP, and Network Security (NOTE: Skillport is CAC enabled).

Perform the duties of an Infrastructure Technician for a minimum of 5 years (e.g., Air Force Network Operations Security Center/Network Control Center (NOSC/NCC), Base Communications Support, and Air Communications Squadrons).
Pass a third party evaluation assessing the individual's knowledge, competency, technical proficiency, and qualifications to perform the job of a Network Infrastructure Technician.
Complete the NMI checklist.
The checklist was reviewed by the Earner's supervisor and recommended for the award of the NMI Engineer badge.
For additional information on the Cyberspace Support digital badge initiative and the earning process, please see the linked information sheet.

426d9afb-4ecc-49ea-b1c7-5a8292a0a566.description: The earner of this badge acquired knowledge of eXtreme software Programming (XP) developer concepts that require highly adaptive teams to utilize rapid prototyping, pair programming, test-driven development, immediate customer feedback, continuous integration/continuous deployment with small incremental releases, the 5 XP values (communication, simplicity, feedback, courage, and respect), and 12 XP practices.
426d9afb-4ecc-49ea-b1c7-5a8292a0a566.name: eXtreme Programming Developer - Bronze

badge_template_activities.title: Agile Software Development Fundamentals

Complete at least two (2) courses that in combination, cover at least Agile methodology, XP principles, and at least one (1) of the following topics: test-driven development, rapid prototyping, continuous integration/continuous delivery, or pair-programming. Courses must incorporate some form of assessment.
Complete the XP Developer – Bronze checklist.
The checklist was reviewed by the Earner's supervisor and recommended for the award of the XP Developer – Bronze badge.
For additional information on the Cyberspace Support digital badge initiative and the earning process, please see the linked information sheet.

1bf032b8-491b-4499-b113-eb72f99317ac.description: The earner of this badge applied eXtreme software Programming (XP) developer knowledge and skills to lead teams, engineer solutions to customer requirements, design automated programmable interfaces, create unit and functional tests, mentor junior eXtreme Programming developers, and deliver software source code to a production environment.
1bf032b8-491b-4499-b113-eb72f99317ac.name: eXtreme Programming Developer - Gold

badge_template_activities.title: eXtreme Programming Developer - Silver
Perform for one (1) year on an eXtreme Programming team as a fully certified/trained member.
Submit a software source code repository for a project on which the earner was the senior developer and designed and implemented module and system interfaces.

Submit two (2) performance reviews of earner's application of eXtreme Programming behaviors, skills, and abilities from a senior developer of a software development project.  Reviews will be from two separate individuals.
Complete the XP Developer – Gold checklist.
The checklist was reviewed by the Earner's supervisor and recommended for the award of the XP Developer – Gold badge.
For additional information on the Cyberspace Support digital badge initiative and the earning process, please see the linked information sheet.

d6f839e1-5548-4d04-ae24-3beb7133c30b.description: The earner of this badge applied eXtreme software Programming (XP) developer knowledge and skills to work on a development team, engineer solutions to customer requirements, design unit and functional tests, and deliver software source code.
d6f839e1-5548-4d04-ae24-3beb7133c30b.name: eXtreme Programming Developer - Silver

badge_template_activities.title: eXtreme Programming Developer - Bronze
Submit a sample of source code, at least 1 KB in size, in which the earner was a developer.
Perform for one (1) year on an eXtreme Programming team as a fully certified/trained member.
Submit two (2) performance reviews of earner's application of eXtreme Programming behaviors, skills, and abilities as a developer and team member.  Reviews will be from two separate individuals.
Complete the XP Developer – Silver checklist.
The checklist was reviewed by the Earner's supervisor and recommended for the award of the XP Developer – Silver badge.
For additional information on the Cyberspace Support digital badge initiative and the earning process, please see the linked information sheet.

43d27f1a-be39-43dc-b587-8560ddbd4d19.description: The earner of this badge acquired knowledge of the roles and responsibilities of the eXtreme Programming (XP) Product Manager to include immediate customer feedback, continuous integration/continuous deployment with small incremental releases, the 5 XP values (communication, simplicity, feedback, courage, and respect), and 12 XP practices to produce maximum business value in the shortest time-span possible.
43d27f1a-be39-43dc-b587-8560ddbd4d19.name: eXtreme Programming Product Manager - Bronze

alignments.name: Product Management: An Overview
alignments.description: A course on Digital U that would fulfill the course requirement. For a Digital U account, visit the Airmen Coders Initiative website at https://airmencoders.us.

alignments.name: Product Management: Building a Product Roadmap and Agile Product Management
alignments.description: A course on Digital U that would fulfill the course requirement. For a Digital U account, visit the Airmen Coders Initiative website at https://airmencoders.us.

alignments.name: Product Management: Communication for Product Managers
alignments.description: A course on Digital U that would fulfill the course requirement. For a Digital U account, visit the Airmen Coders Initiative website at https://airmencoders.us.

alignments.name: Product Management: Metrics for Product Managers
alignments.description: A course on Digital U that would fulfill the course requirement. For a Digital U account, visit the Airmen Coders Initiative website at https://airmencoders.us.

badge_template_activities.title: Agile Software Development Fundamentals
Complete a course that covers the topics listed in the description. Example courses that would fulfill this requirement are listed in the Standards section below.
Complete the XP Product Manager - Bronze checklist.
The checklist was reviewed by the Earner's supervisor and recommended for the award of the XP Product Manager - Bronze badge.
For additional information on the Cyberspace Support digital badge initiative and the earning process, please see the linked information sheet.

6662bc09-7f6d-40fd-9c64-ad1e48f81c35.description: The earner of this badge has applied eXtreme Programming (XP) knowledge and skills to lead teams, curate product backlogs, balance business needs with user needs, and manage the development of software solutions. Furthermore, they've conducted a pre-product research phase and defined goals, problem statements, and a Minimum Viable Product (MVP) for a product team they lead.
6662bc09-7f6d-40fd-9c64-ad1e48f81c35.name: eXtreme Programming Product Manager - Master

badge_template_activities.title: eXtreme Programming Product Manager - Silver
Complete two years as an eXtreme Programming Product Manager.
Provide a portfolio of products managed, to include the product name, problem statement/solution description, and stage of development, verified by team lead or equivalent.

Complete a pre-product research phase (e.g. Discovery and Framing) where product risks, stakeholder goals/antigoals, and success metrics are identified; the problem space has been explored and a singular problem has been selected to be addressed; and a solution brainstorming has been conducted and a Minimum Viable Product has been determined.
UX Designer 101/Designer Basics
Complete the eXtreme Programming Product Manager - Gold checklist.
The checklist was reviewed by the Earner's supervisor and recommended for the award of the eXtreme Programming Product Manager - Gold badge.
For additional information on the Cyberspace Support digital badge initiative and the earning process, please see the linked information sheet.

a1abf2e5-604d-45f7-841f-78fbb1cda06b.description: The earner of this badge has applied eXtreme Programming (XP) Product Manager knowledge and skills to lead teams, curate product backlogs, balance business needs with user needs, and manage the development of software solutions.
a1abf2e5-604d-45f7-841f-78fbb1cda06b.name: eXtreme Programming Product Manager - Silver

badge_template_activities.title: eXtreme Programming Product Manager - Bronze
Complete one year as an eXtreme Programming Product Manager.
Provide a portfolio of products managed, to include the product name, problem statement/solution description, and stage of development, verified by team lead or equivalent.
Submit a professional journal describing challenges within a product development cycle and how those challenges were overcome/addressed.
Complete the eXtreme Programming Product Manager - Silver Rubric
The rubric was reviewed by Earner's supervisor and recommended for the award of the eXtreme Programming Product Manager - Silver badge.
For additional information on the Cyberspace Support digital badge initiative and the earning process, please see the linked information sheet.
